391.description: Great opportunity for networking and recharging yourself.

131.title: Networking & Developer meets Startup
131.description: Join us at the end of the day for networking over drinks.  As well as general networking, there will be a chance for developers to meet our community of local start-ups. If you’re a developer curious about what start-up life is like or you’re looking for opportunities, come along to meet start-ups happy to share their experiences and who are on the lookout for their next co-founder, CTO or developer! If you just want to catch up with some of the other attendees and network with them, that's also great.  All welcome!

292.title: Welcome to the Mobile track
292.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers.

392.title: Welcome to the Web track
392.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers.

592.title: Welcome to the Cloud and Machine Learning track

593.description: End of the conference, beginning of the networking and drinks.

493.title: Tech Entrepreneurship track wrap up
493.description: End of the conference, beginning of the networking and drinks.

201.title: Android Things 101
201.description: In this talk Raul will explain the basic concepts of Android Things (Android for IoT), explain how to setup the development environment for it and show how easy is to work with the different peripherals. For this, he'll use the most popular Dev Kit for Android Things: A Raspberry Pi with a Rainbow HAT (which has lots of sensors, input and output devices).

202.title: Android Instant Apps
202.description: This session will introduce the audience to the concept of Android Instant Apps. It highlights some tools that can be used and demonstrates what to keep in mind when developing an instant app.

203.title: Profile, Debug, Analyze
203.description: Android Studio has a new suite of tools for analysing your apps and for debugging runtime errors and performance problems. Developers are also becoming more aware about the need to make their apps leaner and faster, but often don't know what tools are at their disposal. I will share with you several classes of common debugging problems and the appropriate tools to tackle them.

204.title: Using Kotlin in production
204.description: Kotlin has fast become the new hotness in the Android world - but what is the reality of adding it to an app which is rapidly being built for a fast growing startup? In this talk we'll cover how we went about adding Kotlin to the Monzo app, why we made those choices and how it went.

205.title: AR Core - An Introduction
205.description: With more than two billion active devices, Android is the largest mobile platform in the world. And for the past nine years, Google have worked to create a rich set of tools, frameworks and APIs that deliver developers’ creations to people everywhere.   In this talk, we'll go through some of the features of AR Core.

206.title: I like the way you move
206.description:
Good use of animations can not only help make your app’s UI more intuitive, but can also build emotional attachment with your users.

Mark Allison will explore the subtleties of why some animations work where others don’t; The distinct components of effective animation; and, of course, some detailed worked examples of how to create amazing Android animations.

207.title: Flutter - evolving mobile
207.description:
Mobile platforms such as iOS and Android are almost 10 years old. They’ve matured becoming more stable and richer in features, creating a market bigger than their creator’s expectations. Along with their stunning success, customer’s appetite for impressive skilfully tailored user experiences has grown as well. 

But with the growing demand for quality, is there any way to make mobile development easier whilst still delivering stunning apps? What about making development more pleasant; is that really possible?

Flutter is a new platform for mobile development which is ready to change the way we develop high performance, customised mobile applications. Built from the ground up on learnings taken from existing platforms, it rethinks the way UI works. It gives absolute freedom in creating user experiences, regardless of the underlying target platform.

301.title: A comprehensive approach to PWA and offline

302.title: Solving Layout Problems with CSS Grid and Friends
302.description: CSS Grid Layout launched into the majority of our browsers in 2017. As designers and developers have started to use Grid I’ve been answering a lot of questions about the specification. In this talk I’ll answer some of the common questions about Grid Layout in production - from dealing with old browsers to what might come next in CSS for layout. There will be plenty of practical tips for you to use in your projects today.

303.title: V8 internals for JavaScript developers
303.description: This presentation demonstrates how learning just a little bit about JavaScript engine internals can help you improve the run-time performance of your JavaScript code — not just in V8 specifically, but across all JavaScript engines!

304.title: Let Firebase help you to build better Web apps
304.description:
What is the first thing that comes to your mind when you are starting to develop your product? You need to think about all sort of features. How you are going to grow your app. Engage your audience and make money in the process, right?

What if you could choose a platform to build your app with confidence, without the need of managing infrastructure, trusted by companies like The New York Times, The Economist, Shazam and much more. Firebase gives you the tools and infrastructure you need to build better apps and grow businesses. Join this talk and learn how to overcome the challenges of build extraordinary web apps using Firebase.

305.title: AMP: A Library for Beautiful and Responsive Sites
305.description: It is common knowledge that Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) are fast. Less commonly known is that AMP is also a fantastic library for building user-friendly, responsive web sites. I'm going to talk about how AMP makes it easy to create beautiful interactive websites.

306.title: Designing an empathic Google Assistant
306.description:
We are in an age of blending horizons and blurring devices brought alive by ambient assistive companions. Everything is talking, everything has a brain...and we respond to these "presences" with many of the same feelings and reactions as if they were sentient beings. It's not our fault. It's 150,000 years of human hardwiring telling us that a speaking thing is not just an “it,” it’s alive and aware and connecting with us. With “ears” and “eyes” sensing, it becomes even more emotionally compelling and/or complex.

How might we design for Emotional Intelligence to make people feel that these experiences are useful, familiar, comfortable, positive, supportive and trust-worthy.

307.title: The evolution of asynchronous JavaScript
307.description: One of JavaScript’s strengths is how it handles asynchrony. Async is one of the most important and often misunderstood part of Javascript or any other language. We will see how dealing with asynchrony in JavaScript evolved over the years. It all started with callbacks, it landed on generators and...

401.title: Google Apps Script - gateway to Google APIS
401.description: Apps Script is Google's language for automating G Suite. It is based on JavaScript, runs in the cloud, and has native  access to the underlying APIS that power G Suite Apps. It also provides a powerful serverless environment for working in an authenticated environment to connect to other services and APIS. Apps Script simplifies integrating G Suite apps with other APIS, and is an ideal environment for mashing up prototypes in a startup environment, even if the end state platform is ends up being something other than G Suite.

402.title: Startup Tech: how not to suck as CTO
402.description: Technology decisions at a startup can make, or break, their success. Mastering the art of making those choices isn't easy, and arguably, knowing how to code makes it harder. We'll talk about that, and offer some ideas to help mitigate the risks.

403.title: The Google Analytics of Things
403.description: Did you know Google Analytics isn't just for website tracking? Since launching Google Analytics in November 2005 the Internet has radically changed moving away from static content to fully interactive web applications. Google Analytics has also radically changed moving away from website pageviews allowing you to analyse virtually any event on any platform. This talk is designed to highlight some of the Google Analytics features available to developers you may not be aware of inspiring you to look at your analytics problems and opportunities in new ways. For example, we look at how Google Analytics can be used as part of the Internet of Things, using low cost computing like Raspberry Pis for recording and analysing everything from sensor data to physical switches. We also look at bridging offline and asynchronous tracking sending measurement data in batches when connectivity is reestablished as well as pushing data from third party APIs into Google Analytics using free tools. After this talk you'll hopefully look at Google Analytics in a completely different way.

404.title: Idea to Launch
404.description: This talk explores Alessia’s entrepreneurial journey and what she learned bringing ideas to life. After co-founding her own digital product studio Code & Wander and working with top brands, she will share her experiences and discuss what it takes to go from an idea to launch.

405.title: Beta to Live
405.description: With the experience of launching products at her own digital agency, Code & Wander, Alessia discusses the steps required to move a product from beta to live. From testing to constant iterations she outlines the dos and don’ts.

406.title: Customer Acquisition: Navigating Your Way to Success

407.title: Raising a Seed Round
407.description: How to raise a seed round from London based investors.

408.title: Digital Marketing: What not to do for your business & podcast live session
408.description:
Sit in, and join in, on the recording of a live episode of the Digital Marketing Podcast, an iTunes top 10 business podcast globally.

In this extremely practical session, Daniel and Ciaran, share the mistakes and techniques they wished they had avoided and what they did that worked. Full of practical hands on techniques and tools, attendees will leave with a wealth of experience and tools they can use straight away.

Attendees will also receive a toolkit listing 50 of the most useful digital marketing tools and access to a library of podcasts to help them implement their digital activity.

501.title: Kubernetes: hyper-scale computing for the masses
501.description:
Kubernetes was started in 2014 by Google, based off their experience running production systems at huge scale for more than 10 years. A completely open source project, Kubernetes helps orchestrate and manage applications running across 5 servers, or 5,000.

By providing a meaningful API to interact with, it's possible to deploy code rapidly and consistently, and even to multiple cloud platforms at a time. This helps teams focus on their own applications, instead of the systems on which they run.

In this talk I'll introduce Kubernetes and show how easy it is to deploy a Docker-ized application to GKE, Google's managed Kubernetes-as-a-Service.

502.title: End-to-end streaming analytics on Google Cloud Platform
502.description: Do you think you can write a system to get data from sensors across the world, do real time analytics, and display the data on a dashboard in under 100 lines of code? Would you like to add some monitoring and autoscaling too? And what about serverless? In this talk I'll show you all the technologies GCP offers to build such a system reliably and at scale.

503.title: Creative Applications of Machine Learning
503.description: Over the past couple of years, there has been increasing interest in applying the latest advances in machine learning to creative projects in art, music, film, theatre and beyond. From Google's DeepDream and style transfer to the world's first computer-generated musical playing in London's West End, more and more creative AI projects are moving beyond the world of research and academia into the public eye. This talk will give an overview of creative projects using RNNs, ConvNets, GANs and other models.

504.title: An implementation of generalised curriculum learning using Tensorflow and Keras
504.description: In this talk, we focus on a technique that allow a machine learning model to minimize two different cost functions (each representing a different task) together, by gradually switching between the tasks. This technique can be thought as a generalisation of curriculum learning, and can in principle be applied to n tasks. We present the results of an experiment conducted on the MNIST dataset and implemented using Tensorflow and Keras.

505.title: Intro to Google Cloud storage and computing
505.description: There's a lot to grok in cloud computing, and trying to understand it all can be daunting. In this session, Marc will walk us through a hands-on, practical guided tour of the Google Cloud Platform, with a particular focus on storage and computing.

506.title: Lowering the barriers: Machine Learning and Cloud
506.description: Marc will provide an overview of Google's AI APIs, which offer easy access to rich, pre-trained models via a single API call with lots of demos, and a brief overview of Cloud ML Engine, which allows training and hosting of custom machine learning models in the Cloud.

507.title: How to build an AI startup
507.description: How your data source is the most important part of starting an AI company. Especially if you are doing something new and unique, which Headstart AI is, you start with no data, so being able to collect new and valuable data correctly to train your ML models well is crucial to the success of an AI startup. Jeremy and Luca will touch on the challenges as well as solutions regarding data collection and usage of unlabelled data to perform unsupervised machine learning.

508.title: Collaborative Machine Learning using Kubernetes and Jupyter
508.description: The Jupyter notebook is the established development environment of the data scientist, typically running on a laptop or remote server. However the default Jupyter server presents challenges which make doing collaborative machine learning at scale difficult. In this talk, I'll discuss these challenges of security, scalability, and collaboration, and describe the Kubernetes-based infrastructure we’ve built at ASI Data Science to overcome them.

199.title: Codelabs
199.description: Drop in for a range of codelabs we'll be running throughout the day, supported by our volunteers. We'll be covering a range of topics including web, mobile, machine learning, Google Apps and Actions on Google along with the chance to win one of 5 Google Homes for best idea for a voice app if you complete the codelab. If you’re planning on attending any of our codelabs, make sure to download any materials, SDKs, and tools beforehand. Then, properly configure your environment. Bring your laptop and power supply. Find the codelabs at https://codelabs.developers.google.com/devfest-lon.

speakers.name: Raul Portales
speakers.title: Android Developer
speakers.shortBio: Raul Portales is a Software Engineer working on mobile since the early times.
speakers.bio: Raul Portales is a Software Engineer working on mobile since the early times. He switched from Symbian to Android in 2009 (before Android versions had tasty names) and never looked back. He loves public speaking and has presented at several DroidCons, Game Developer Conferences and many GDGs. After working a lot on the front end - especially building games - Raul has developed a special interest in UX and UI.

speakers.name: Ben Weiss
speakers.title: Android Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Ben is a Developer Programs Engineer at the Android Developer Relations team at Google.
speakers.bio:
Ben is a Developer Programs Engineer at the Android Developer Relations team at Google.
He’s been working with Android since the first public release.
Recently his focus was on Animations, Transitions, Android Instant Apps and Kotlin.

speakers.name: Peter Beverloo
speakers.title: Senior Software Engineer
speakers.shortBio: TBA
speakers.bio: TBA

speakers.name: Bruce Mcpherson
speakers.title: Consultant
speakers.shortBio: Bruce is a veteran IT practioner, with 30+ years as CIO, Chief Architect and many other roles – mainly in large global enterprises.
speakers.bio: Bruce is a veteran IT practioner, with 30+ years as CIO, Chief Architect and many other roles – mainly in large global enterprises. With expertise in each of Google, Microsoft and Oracle technologies his main interest is in integration, and has published several O'Reilly video courses and Books on Google Apps Script and JavaScript. Bruce is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Apps Script and Identity.

badges.name: gde
badges.description: Google Developer Expert for Apps Script and Identity

speakers.name: Mark Masterson
speakers.title: Global Program Manager, Google Launchpad
speakers.shortBio: I work for Google, where I currently help lead one of their startup programs, Google Developers Launchpad.
speakers.bio: I work for Google, where I currently help lead one of their startup programs, Google Developers Launchpad. Prior to Google, I failed miserably as a startup CTO, and prior to that, spent many years in the mines of the financial services industry, being punished for my sins. I like Frisbee and dislike speaker bios.

speakers.name: Rachel Andrew
speakers.title: Invited Expert to the CSS WG
speakers.shortBio: Rachel Andrew is a front and back-end web developer, author and speaker.
speakers.bio: Rachel Andrew is a front and back-end web developer, author and speaker. Author or co-author of 22 books including The New CSS Layout, published in October 2017 by A Book Apart. Rachel is co-founder of the CMS Perch, a Google Developer Expert and an Invited Expert to the CSS Working Group.

speakers.name: Mathias Bynens
speakers.title: JavaScript whisperer
speakers.shortBio: Mathias is a web standards enthusiast with a passion for HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Unicode, performance, and security.
speakers.bio: Mathias is a web standards enthusiast with a passion for HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Unicode, performance, and security.

speakers.name: Juarez Filho
speakers.title: Google Developer Expert
speakers.shortBio: Passionate about traveling and also to share his adventures with Web Technologies and Firebase
speakers.bio: Passionate about traveling and also to share his adventures with Web Technologies and Firebase. As a Google Developer Expert, he’s helping communities all over the world to learn, discover and have fun.

badges.name: gde
badges.description: Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies

speakers.name: Martin Hawksey
speakers.title: GDE Google Apps Script
speakers.shortBio: Martin Hawksey has held advisory roles within the UK EdTech sector and is currently Chief Innovation, Community and Technology Officer at the Association for Learning Technology (ALT)
speakers.bio: Martin Hawksey has held advisory roles within the UK EdTech sector and is currently Chief Innovation, Community and Technology Officer at the Association for Learning Technology (ALT). In these roles Martin has supported the exploration and adoption of innovative approaches to technology enhanced learning. Martin writes extensively on Google Apps Script, a programming tool integrated into Google Drive, and is a member of Google Developer Experts community.

badges.name: gde
badges.description: Google Developer Expert for Google Apps Script

speakers.name: Marc Paulina
speakers.title: User Experience Designer
speakers.shortBio: Marc is a senior designer at Google, focusing on user experience design for the Google Assistant.
speakers.bio: Marc is a senior designer at Google, focusing on user experience design for the Google Assistant. Marc is interested in blending the superpowers of the social sciences, deep listening and design thinking to inspire human-centered experiences that will be the standard of user experience in the future of smart, ambient assistive computing.

speakers.name: James Munnelly
speakers.title: Kubernetes Solutions Engineer
speakers.shortBio: I'm a Solutions Engineer at Jetstack, a Kubernetes focused consultancy. This involves helping customers bend and break Kubernetes to their will, and training their teams to make best use of it.
speakers.bio: I'm a Solutions Engineer at Jetstack, a Kubernetes focused consultancy. This involves helping customers bend and break Kubernetes to their will, and training their teams to make best use of it. I've written a number of extensions for Kubernetes, and work on the core codebase in order to make it easier for others to do the same.

speakers.name: Javier Ramirez
speakers.title: Cloud Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Cloud and big data engineer with a past in software development. Co-founder of teowaki, a consultancy company specialized in GCP.
speakers.bio: Cloud and big data engineer with a past in software development. Co-founder of teowaki, a consultancy company specialized in GCP. I've been a Google Developer Expert in Cloud for over 4 years and a GCP trainer for over 2.

speakers.name: Sebastian Benz
speakers.title: Developer Advocate
speakers.shortBio: Sebastian works with developers around the world helping them build great experiences for web and Android. He created and maintains ampbyexample.com.
speakers.bio: Sebastian works with developers around the world helping them build great experiences for web and Android. He created and maintains ampbyexample.com.

speakers.name: Emma Guy
speakers.title: Android Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Emma is currently an Android Engineer at Monzo, building a better bank. Prior to this, she was at couple of app agencies, creating a number of different apps for a wide variety of clients
speakers.bio: Emma is currently an Android Engineer at Monzo, building a better bank. Prior to this, she was at couple of app agencies, creating a number of different apps for a wide variety of clients. She began her career writing enterprise software at a couple of different companies before tinkering enough with Android in her free time to know she wanted to pursue it full time.

speakers.name: Luba Elliott
speakers.title: Creative AI Researcher
speakers.shortBio: Luba Elliott is a curator, artist and researcher looking at artificial intelligence in the creative industries.
speakers.bio: Luba Elliott is a curator, artist and researcher looking at artificial intelligence in the creative industries. She is currently working to educate and engage the broader public about the latest developments in creative AI through monthly meetups, talks and tech demonstrations. Prior to that, she worked in venture capital and art startups.

speakers.name: Gen Ashley
speakers.shortBio: Gen is the Director of Women Who Code London, a Lead for Google Women Techmakers London, NASA Space Apps Challenge London and Twitter Developer Community London. She is also part of the leadership committee for Ada's List.
speakers.bio: Gen is the Director of Women Who Code London and is a very active leader in the Tech community in London. Aside from her involvement with Women Who Code she is a Lead for Google Women Techmakers London, NASA Space Apps Challenge London and Twitter Developer Community London. She is also part of the leadership committee for Ada's List (a network for women in technology). She is co-organiser of COED:CODE, OpenTechSchool London and London Game Developers. She was the Head of Developer Outreach at Skills Matter and a former VP / Business Development Manager / Project Manager at Citigroup. In 2016 Gen helped lead Anita Borg Institute London and was actively instrumental in delivering the very first 1-Day Grace Hopper Conference in Europe which was held in London.

speakers.name: Swav Kulinski
speakers.title: Lead Android Developer
speakers.shortBio: Coding since 1986, currently Android evangelist, leading a Droid team at The App Business. Swav's interest is around evolution of technology, spotting early distruptors and finding ways how to adopt them.
speakers.bio: Coding since 1986, currently Android evangelist, leading a Droid team at The App Business. Swav's interest is around evolution of technology, spotting early distruptors and finding ways how to adopt them.

speakers.name: Giovanni Vacanti
speakers.title: Physicist, Data Scientist
speakers.shortBio: After obtaining a master degree in physics at University of Palermo, Italy, Giovanni joined the graduate program at Centre for quantum technologies, National University of Singapore, where he obtained a Phd in Theoretical physics in 2013.
speakers.bio: After obtaining a master degree in physics at University of Palermo, Italy, Giovanni joined the graduate program at Centre for quantum technologies, National University of Singapore, where he obtained a Phd in Theoretical physics in 2013. Until 2015, he worked as a postdoctoral researcher in theoretical quantum physics at Institut Neel, Grenoble, France. Since 2016 he works as a Data scientist at Seldon technologies , developing  machine learning solutions for various use cases.

speakers.name: Alessia Sannazzaro
speakers.title: Entrepreneur
speakers.shortBio: Alessia is the co-founder of Code & Wander, a digital product studio with a travelling twist.
speakers.bio: Alessia is the co-founder of Code & Wander, a digital product studio with a travelling twist. After graduating in Design and Innovation, Alessia entered the startup scene and gained recognition for her success in the NACUE Varsity Pitch, Get In The Ring and the London Entrepreneurs Challenge. Since then she’s worked in digital agencies collaborating with top brands to create internal and external products and strategies.

speakers.name: Aygul Zagidullina
speakers.title: Google Launchpad Mentor
speakers.shortBio: Aygul is an experienced community manager and advocate for women in tech. Ex-Googler. PhD in quantum chemistry.
speakers.bio: Aygul is an experienced community manager and advocate for women in tech. Ex-Googler. PhD in quantum chemistry. Enthusiastic serial volunteer who is involved in many innovative projects (Google Launchpad Mentor for marketing/ growth, Google Developer Group and Women Techmakers Lead for London, Google Top Contributor, a distinguished international speaker). Early adopter. Technology admirer. Named as one of The NEXT 100 Top Influencers of the European Digital Industry in 2013.

speakers.name: Alessandro Cinelli
speakers.title: Tech Lead
speakers.shortBio: Alessandro Cinelli (a.k.a. cirpo) is currently working in London as Lead/Tech Coach at AND Digital. He loves playing with programming languages and giving back to the community.
speakers.bio: Alessandro Cinelli (a.k.a. cirpo) is currently working in London as Lead/Tech Coach at AND Digital. He loves playing with programming languages and giving back to the community. When he was in Italy he has been a board member of the Italian PHP, Javascript User Group and WEBdeBS, co-organizing several events such as agileday, phpDay, jsDay, nosqlday and Nodejsconf. These days he is busy co-organizing tech events with @WEBdeLDN in London.

speakers.name: Mark Allison
speakers.title: Android Developer
speakers.shortBio: Mark Allison is a GDE for Android and software engineer with over 30 years’ experience. He is passionate about providing the user with the best possible experience.
speakers.bio:
Mark Allison is a GDE for Android and software engineer with over 30 years’ experience. He is passionate about providing the user with the best possible experience. He has developed both server and client side, most commonly Android on the client side, but with also for iOS, HTML5, Symbian, and J2ME. Mark writes a technical blog (http://blog.stylingandroid.com) which focuses on Android UI/UX topics, but often covers more general Android development techniques.

When not being geeky, Mark likes to unwind by hurling abuse at football referees, specifically those who are unkind to his beloved Watford FC with whom he holds a season ticket. He also has a deep love of spicy food, beer, and malt whisky; and consumes these at every opportunity!

Mark is happily married with a grown up step-daughter, and lives in Hertfordshire, UK.

speakers.name: John Spindler
speakers.title: CEO & Co-Founder
speakers.shortBio: CEO of Capital Enterprise, Co-Founder of the London Co-Investment Fund and founder and partner on the AI Seed Fund, John has fair claim to be the most active seed stage investor in the UK.
speakers.bio: CEO of Capital Enterprise, Co-Founder of the London Co-Investment Fund and founder and partner on the AI Seed Fund, John has fair claim to be the most active seed stage investor in the UK.

speakers.name: Marc Cohen
speakers.title: Developer Advocate
speakers.shortBio: Marc builds tools, demos, codelabs, and other things to make the Google Cloud Platform easier and more fun to use. Originally from New Jersey, then Seattle, he now lives and works in London.
speakers.bio: Marc builds tools, demos, codelabs, and other things to make the Google Cloud Platform easier and more fun to use. Originally from New Jersey, then Seattle, he now lives and works in London. He has co-authored a book about Google Compute Engine and wrote the product announcement demo. In a previous life, he developed communication systems at Bell Labs and Lucent Technologies. Outside of work, he enjoys indie music, quirky films (especially documentaries), books, puzzles, and chess. He's also very interested in education, teaching, and applying technology (like spaced repetition) to enhance the learning experience.

speakers.name: Daniel Rowles
speakers.title: CEO & Lead Trainer
speakers.company: Target Internet - The Digital Marketing Podcast
speakers.shortBio: Daniel has been working in digital marketing for the past 19 years, with extensive experience working both client-side and within the agency environment.
speakers.bio: Daniel has been working in digital marketing for the past 19 years, with extensive experience working both client-side and within the agency environment. He is a Course Director for the Chartered Institute for Marketing, an award-winning author, and lecturer at Imperial College and Cranfield School of Management.

speakers.name: Ciaran Rogers
speakers.title: Marketing Director
speakers.company: Target Internet - The Digital Marketing Podcast
speakers.shortBio: Ciaran is an experienced digital strategist with over 19 years experience, he has worked for and trained a large number of international brands including, and was a lead lecturer for Middlesex University on their Digital Marketing MA programme.
speakers.bio: Ciaran is an experienced digital strategist with over 19 years experience, he has worked for and trained a large number of international brands including, and was a lead lecturer for Middlesex University on their Digital Marketing MA programme.

speakers.name: Wojtek Kaliciński
speakers.title: Developer Advocate
speakers.shortBio: I am a Developer Advocate at Google and I work closely with the Android Studio team to provide outreach on new Studio and Tools releases and framework features.
speakers.bio: I am a Developer Advocate at Google and I work closely with the Android Studio team to provide outreach on new Studio and Tools releases and framework features. I enjoy looking for ways to make apps more usable, mostly through better development patterns and code optimizations.

speakers.name: Andrew Brookes
speakers.title: CTO
speakers.shortBio: Andrew​ ​Brookes​ is the co-founder and CTO of ASI Data Science. A computer scientist with over 10 years of software development experience, he is...
speakers.bio: Andrew​ ​Brookes​ is the co-founder and CTO of ASI Data Science. A computer scientist with over 10 years of software development experience, he is responsible for the company-wide software engineering efforts and the building of the data science product, SherlockML. Previously he lead engineering teams building BlackRock’s global portfolio management systems.

speakers.name: Jeremy Hindle
speakers.title: CTO and Cofounder
speakers.shortBio: Jeremy, the CTO and Cofounder of Headstart AI, is a third-time founder and self-taught programmer who has worked with Machine Learning for 8 years.
speakers.bio: Jeremy, the CTO and Cofounder of Headstart AI, is a third-time founder and self-taught programmer who has worked with Machine Learning for 8 years. He initially learnt how to code through an interest in the games industry, running one of the world’s biggest Minecraft communities (LPMinecraft). Most recently, he founded Omnigon Games where he and his team were making UemeU, an ambitious ‘next generation’ sandbox game, which was acquired by Jagex.

speakers.name: Kaan Mamikoglu
speakers.title: Mobile Software Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Kaan is a mobile software engineer at MyDrive Solutions in London, UK. As an active community builder, he has co-organized a lot of developer events in Turkey and the UK such as DevFests, Android Developer Days’, Android Study Jams, etc.
speakers.bio: Kaan is a mobile software engineer at MyDrive Solutions in London, UK. As an active community builder, he has co-organized a lot of developer events in Turkey and the UK such as DevFests, Android Developer Days’, Android Study Jams, etc. Besides being a Google Developer Group (GDG) London co-organizer, he is a Google Top Contributor (TC) and a Google Local Guide. Kaan is passionate about exploring new technologies and traveling around the world.

speakers.name: Nicole Rodrigues
speakers.title: Creative Writer
speakers.shortBio: Professional migraineur. A mashup of writer and localization specialist for the Google Assistant's Personality in Brazilian Portuguese.
speakers.bio: Professional migraineur. A mashup of writer and localization specialist for the Google Assistant's Personality in Brazilian Portuguese.

speakers.name: Francesco Pontillo
speakers.title: Software Engineer
speakers.shortBio: Officially an Android developer at Novoda, he is an undercover multi technologist who likes to hack with all kinds of technologies. Clear eyes, full hearts, can't lose.
speakers.bio: Officially an Android developer at Novoda, he is an undercover multi technologist who likes to hack with all kinds of technologies. Clear eyes, full hearts, can't lose.

speakers.name: Amanda Cavallaro
speakers.title: Software Developer
speakers.shortBio: Amanda Cavallaro is a software developer, passionate about Cloud technologies, Human Computer Interactions and Chatbots.
speakers.bio: Amanda Cavallaro is a software developer, passionate about Cloud technologies, Human Computer Interactions and Chatbots. She works at resolver.co.uk and is a Women Techmakers Lead and Community Organiser at Google Developer Group Cloud London. You can speak to her in Portuguese, English, Italian and and a little of Japanese. More info on her personal website: http://amanda.ml/index.html

speakers.name: Sharif Salah
speakers.title: Technical Writer
speakers.shortBio: Sharif currently writes technical documentation for Google Cloud Platform. He's previously written developer documentation for Android as well as technical training content for Google Cloud Platform.
speakers.bio: Sharif currently writes technical documentation for Google Cloud Platform. He's previously written developer documentation for Android as well as technical training content for Google Cloud Platform. He enjoys public speaking, facilitating training classes, and generally spending time helping the developer community. When not writing technical documentation, he can usually be found reading science fiction, cooking, or walking in the countryside.

speakers.name: Jose Nieto
speakers.title: Android Content Developer
speakers.shortBio: Jose works as an Android Content Developer at Udacity, where he contributes to build the courses and learning experiences for thousands of future Android Developers all around the world.
speakers.bio: After completing a career change to become an Android Development, Jose started collaborating with Udacity as Connect Session Leader for Associate Android Developer Fast Track students. Back again into education, Jose quickly got deeply involved in it. Being able to have an impact on so many others' lives and helping them to get closer to their dream jobs has been an immensely fulfilling experience for him.
